title: TUI: created URL not visible in URL list after create (pagination/filter/offset)
description:
The Bubble Tea TUI refreshes the URL list after a successful create, but it refreshes using the *current* pagination offset (and re-applies any active filter query). If the user is not on the first page (offset>0), a newly-created URL (sorted newest-first) will land on offset=0 and therefore won’t appear on the current page; the UI can even show the empty-state text which reads like there are no URLs at all.

Code pointers:
- After create success: `internal/tui/model.go` refreshes with `listURLsCmd(m.cfg, m.pageSize, m.offset)` (keeps offset) and `listURLsMsg` handling re-applies filter.
- Empty state message in `model.go` when `len(m.filtered)==0` is: "No URLs yet..." which is misleading when offset>0 and/or filter hides results.

Why this matches the reported symptoms:
- Server query orders by `created_at DESC` (`internal/adapters/repository/sqlc/sqlite/queries.sql`), so new URLs appear on page 1.
- If user was on page 2+ or had a filter applied, the new URL won’t be visible after create even though creation succeeded.
acceptance_criteria:
- Repro shows: create succeeds but URL not visible on current page.
- Expected behavior decided and implemented (likely: on create success, jump to first page and refresh; optionally clear filter or provide an explicit toast indicating it may be filtered out).
- Empty-state text is not misleading when offset>0 and/or filter is active (e.g., differentiate "No URLs on this page" vs "No URLs yet" vs "No matches for filter").
- Add/adjust TUI unit test(s) to lock in the behavior (model update after create should reset offset and/or clear filter before refreshing, per decided UX).
notes: Research artifact written: `thoughts/shared/research/2026-01-06_cli-tui-testing-and-url-list.md` (local). It captures the likely root cause (create refresh preserves offset + filter reapply) and a concrete repro.
close_reason: Implemented TUI fix: after create success, reset offset/cursor to 0 before refreshing so new URL appears (newest-first). Updated empty-state messaging to distinguish: no URLs yet vs no URLs on this page (offset>0) vs no matches for filter; added unit tests covering offset reset and empty-state cases.

title: Document and validate full CLI/TUI testing workflow
description:
We need a clear, end-to-end testing guide for the `mjr` CLI (currently only `mjr tui`) that covers unit tests, integration tests, and any manual/automatable E2E checks.

What exists today:
- TUI has unit-level tests in `internal/tui/*_test.go` (model update behavior, create/list/delete/analytics cmd tests using `httptest`).
- Server/API integration tests exist (e.g. `internal/infrastructure/http/server/e2e_integration_test.go`).
- Browser UI E2E tests exist via Playwright in `e2e/` (not CLI, but relevant to overall app regression).

Gaps / questions to resolve:
- How to run a realistic TUI smoke test against a running server (local SQLite) in a repeatable way.
- Whether we want to automate TUI interaction (likely hard) vs codify a manual checklist.

Deliverable:
- Add a doc section (README or docs-site) describing: prerequisites, env vars (`MJR_BASE_URL`, `MJR_TOKEN`), commands (`go test ./...`, `make test-unit`, `make test-integration`), and a short manual smoke checklist for the TUI (list/refresh/create/delete/analytics).
acceptance_criteria:
- A single documented procedure exists for running all relevant CLI/TUI tests locally and in CI.
- Procedure references the actual existing test commands and key env vars.
- Includes a short manual smoke checklist for the TUI (until automation is added).
notes:
Completion notes (no code changes):

## Canonical test entrypoints
From repo root:
- `make test` (runs codegen + all Go tests)
- `make test-unit` (codegen + `go test -short ./...`)
- `make test-integration` (codegen + server integration tests)

Codegen prerequisite:
- `make generate` (sqlc + templ); required before tests in CI.

Browser E2E (HTML UI):
- `cd e2e && npm install`
- `npx playwright install --with-deps chromium`
- `npm test`

## CLI/TUI-specific automated coverage
- Unit tests: `go test ./internal/tui -run Test -v` (subset) or via `make test[-unit]`.
- TUI cmd tests use `httptest` to validate requests to `/api/urls` etc.

## Manual TUI smoke checklist (recommended)
Pre-reqs:
- Server: set `AUTH_TOKENS`, run `go run ./cmd/server` (or `make build-server && ./bin/server`).
- TUI: set `MJR_BASE_URL` + `MJR_TOKEN`, run `go run ./cmd/mjr tui`.

Checklist:
1) Startup: list loads (GET /api/urls), status shows “Loaded X/Y”.
2) Refresh: press `r`, list reloads.
3) Create: press `c`, enter valid URL, submit; confirm status “Created: … (copied…)”.
4) Verify list shows new URL (note: see bug mjrwtf-57s re pagination/filter).
5) Analytics: select item, press `a`, ensure analytics loads; press `b` back.
6) Delete: press `d`, confirm with Enter/y; verify removed from list.
7) Pagination: create enough URLs to exceed 20; verify `n/p` page.
8) Filter: press `/`, type part of short code/original url, enter; verify filtered count.

All of the above is also captured in `thoughts/shared/research/2026-01-06_cli-tui-testing-and-url-list.md`.

title: Fix failing CI policy test: local action flagged as unpinned
description:
`go test ./...` fails in `internal/ci`:

```
--- FAIL: TestWorkflowPolicyCheck_PassesWithPinnedActionsAndCodegen
Error: unpinned action reference:   - uses: "./.github/actions/my-action"
```

The workflow policy checker treats local composite actions (`uses: "./.github/actions/..."`) as "unpinned" and fails. Local actions are not version-pinned by design, so the checker/test should allow `./.github/actions/*` (or update fixture expectations).

Repro:
- Run `go test ./...`
- Observe failure in `internal/ci/workflow_policy_check_test.go`.

Likely files:
- `internal/ci/workflow_policy_check_test.go`
- workflow policy check implementation under `internal/ci/`
- workflow fixture(s) under `.github/workflows/` or testdata (if present)
- local action under `.github/actions/`
acceptance_criteria:
- `go test ./...` passes (no failure in `internal/ci`).
- Workflow policy check allows local actions (`uses: "./.github/actions/..."`) without requiring pinning.
- Still enforces pinning for remote actions (e.g. `actions/checkout@...` must be a SHA).

title: Implement per-token identity (multi-tenant) for API + web sessions
description:
Bearer auth currently assigns `userID := "authenticated-user"` for all valid tokens (`internal/infrastructure/http/middleware/auth.go`). Web UI login and create flows do the same (`internal/infrastructure/http/handlers/page_handler.go`). This effectively makes the system single-tenant.

Implement a stable derived identity per token (e.g., `sha256(token)` prefix) and use it consistently:
- API bearer auth
- Web login/session creation
- Any ownership checks (`created_by`)

Also update OpenAPI text that calls out single-tenant behavior.
acceptance_criteria:
- Two distinct tokens produce distinct `created_by` values.
- Token A cannot list/delete/see analytics for Token B URLs.
- Existing single-token setup still works.
- Tests updated/added to cover multi-token isolation.
- `go test ./...` passes.
notes:
Research notes (2026-01-06):

Repo currently *already* enforces isolation purely via `created_by` (DB column + repo filtering + use-case ownership checks); the missing piece is that all valid tokens map to the same hardcoded identity.

Hardcoded identity locations ("authenticated-user"):
- `internal/infrastructure/http/middleware/auth.go` (Bearer auth middleware): `userID := "authenticated-user"`
- `internal/infrastructure/http/handlers/page_handler.go`
  - HTML create flow: `userID := "authenticated-user"` then `CreateURLRequest{CreatedBy: userID}`
  - Login flow/session creation: `userID := "authenticated-user"` then `sessionStore.Create(userID)`

How identity is used today:
- API handlers (`internal/infrastructure/http/handlers/url_handler.go`, `analytics_handler.go`) read `middleware.GetUserID(r.Context())` and pass it into the application layer as `CreatedBy` / `RequestedBy`.
- Authorization checks are already based on string equality:
  - Delete: `internal/application/delete_url.go` checks `foundURL.CreatedBy != req.RequestedBy` => `ErrUnauthorizedDeletion`
  - Analytics: `internal/application/get_analytics.go` checks `foundURL.CreatedBy != req.RequestedBy` (currently returns `ErrUnauthorizedDeletion`)
- Listing/counting is already scoped by created_by:
  - `internal/application/list_urls.go` calls `urlRepo.List(ctx, req.CreatedBy, ...)` and `urlRepo.Count(ctx, req.CreatedBy)`
  - SQL layer supports this (`internal/adapters/repository/sqlc/sqlite/queries.sql` has `WHERE created_by = ?`; schema has an index on `urls(created_by)` in `internal/migrations/sqlite/00001_initial_schema.sql`).

Docs/spec touchpoints that explicitly mention single-tenant identity:
- `openapi.yaml` examples/field example values include `created_by: "authenticated-user"` (e.g. around lines ~127, ~133, and component example ~504).
- `docs-site/src/content/docs/api/index.md` explicitly notes single-tenant behavior in “List URLs” and “Analytics” sections.

Tests that currently encode the single shared identity and will likely need updates once per-token identity is implemented:
- `internal/infrastructure/http/middleware/auth_test.go`
- `internal/infrastructure/http/middleware/session_or_bearer_auth_test.go`
- `internal/infrastructure/http/server/auth_integration_test.go`
- `internal/infrastructure/http/server/session_auth_integration_test.go`
- `internal/infrastructure/http/server/analytics_integration_test.go`

Implementation note (design option):
- You can keep the current constant-time token validation, then derive identity directly from the *presented* token (after it’s validated) using a deterministic one-way transform (e.g., `sha256(token)` -> hex string, possibly truncated). This avoids needing to know which configured token matched (the code currently only returns match/configured booleans) and avoids storing/logging raw tokens.
